metadata.title: Week 1 Day 3: Latin Alphabet and Classroom Vocabulary

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation. They should be familiar with the concept of nouns and basic classroom vocabulary in Latin. Previous lessons have introduced the alphabet chant and the importance of discipline in learning a new language. Students have also been introduced to the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance in the context of beginnings.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, students practiced the Latin alphabet and began learning vocabulary related to classroom objects. They also discussed the virtue of discipline and its role in language learning.

primary: Students will recite the Latin alphabet with correct pronunciation.
Students will identify and pronounce basic Latin vocabulary related to classroom objects.
Students will understand the virtue of discipline in the context of language learning.
Students will translate the faith phrase 'In principio' and discuss its significance.
Students will demonstrate the ability to connect Latin sounds to written letters.

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet chant from the previous lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet chant together.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Focus on correct pronunciation and rhythm.

lesson_flow.description: Quick review of classroom vocabulary introduced yesterday.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students match vocabulary words with images.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Ensure students remember the pronunciation and meaning.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce new vocabulary related to classroom objects.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students listen and repeat new vocabulary words.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use flashcards to visually reinforce learning.

lesson_flow.description: Practice pronunciation and usage of new vocabulary in sentences.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students form sentences using new vocabulary.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide feedback on pronunciation and sentence structure.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students reflect on the phrase and share thoughts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the theme of beginnings and discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the lesson and preview the next day's focus.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students share one thing they learned today.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to practice vocabulary at home.

behavior.loop_behavior: Repeat instructions if students seem confused.
